group.pals.android.lib.ui.filechooser.utils.ui
Class LoadingDialog

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      group.pals.android.lib.ui.filechooser.utils.ui.LoadingDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public abstract class LoadingDialog
extends java.lang.Thread

A thread, used to show ProgressDialog while doing some background tasks.
Please read carefully about onExecute().
Only onFinish() or onRaise(Throwable) will be called once. It means if everything is ok, onFinish() will be called, but if an error occurs, LoadingDialog#onRaise() will be called.

Since:
v1.8
Author:
Hai Bison

onExecute

public abstract void onExecute()
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
Your main task here. This method will be called inside run() method.
Note: You should not do any UI task in this method, otherwise things will get out of control.
If you need to interact with UI, you can use Handler. However, remember to test your Handler before you are sure things are ok. It is funny :-)

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - you can throw any exception you want, LoadingDialog will call onRaise(Throwable) and then exit the thread normally.

onFinish

public abstract void onFinish()
Will be called at the end of run() method, after onExecute(), if there is no error occurs.

onRaise

public abstract void onRaise(java.lang.Throwable t)
Will be called when any exception raises, then exit the thread without touching onFinish().

Parameters:
t - - a Throwable got from onExecute()
